# Draft:Software Engineering Handbook

----
Software Engineering Handbook is a 2024 technical reference and career-guidance book by Yusuf Aytas and Ender Demirkaya. The official site states that it covers engineering practices, software development lifecycle, observability, soft skills, leadership, career growth, and life balance.
Background
According to the official site, the authors drew from experience at leading tech firms. Yusuf Aytas is associated with roles at Amazon, Workday, and TripAdvisor; Ender Demirkaya is linked to Microsoft, Meta, and Uber.
The site lists the publication date as 8 May 2024, available in paper and e-book formats, with a page count of 555 and ISBNs of 978-1-3999-8444-7 and 1-3999-8444-6.
Contents
The official website details the following thirteen chapters:
# Types of Software Engineering
# Core Engineering
# Software Development Lifecycle
# Monitoring
# Soft Skills
# Delivering Value
# Getting Paid
# Continuous Learning
# Difficult Situations
# Work-Life Balance
# Corporate Life
# Life Events
# Communication
Each chapter is described as combining technical and non-technical guidance, such as system design, observability, test practices, interpersonal communication, career strategy, and personal resilience.
Reception & Reader Feedback
The site displays testimonials from readers, for example:
> “This comprehensive guide covers nearly every aspect of software engineering. My favorite aspect of the book is its brevity and precision.”
> “You will find guidance on navigating career challenges, from dealing with reorganizations, conflicts, PIP to company norms.”
> “This great book illuminates the suggestions and insights about software engineering, soft skills, and life/career experiences.”
It also states an average rating of 4.9 out of 5 across verified reviews via Amazon and Google Play.
